problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: What does the atomic number of an element represent?
options: Number of electrons in full outer shell
problems.hint: Atomic number = identity of the element’s nucleus.
problems.detailed: The atomic number is the number of protons in the nucleus of an atom and determines which element it is.

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: Elements in the same group (vertical column) of the periodic table share what characteristic?
problems.detailed: Elements in the same group have the same number of valence (outermost) electrons, which gives them similar chemical properties.

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: What is the name for the horizontal rows in the periodic table?
problems.detailed: The horizontal rows in the periodic table are called periods; they correspond to the number of electron shells in the atoms of those elements.

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: Which of the following is a noble gas?
problems.detailed: Argon is one of the noble gases, found in Group 18 of the periodic table, and is known for being chemically inert.

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: Which type of element is typically shiny, malleable, and a good conductor of electricity?
problems.hint: Think of things like copper, iron.
problems.detailed: Metals are shiny, malleable, and good conductors of heat and electricity—these are general properties of metallic elements.
